title: Old iPhone users must update software in order to access web, emails and more, Apple warns
text:
Apple warned users who are still holding onto their iPhone 5s that they must update its operating system by Sunday or lose access to many apps, email, web browsing and more.

The iPhone 5 launched more than seven years ago -- shortly after the death of Apple's founder Steve Jobs -- and hasn't been sold by Apple since 2013.

The new warning from Apple says an iOS update is required "to maintain accurate GPS location and to continue to use functions that rely on correct date and time including App Store, iCloud, email and web browsing."

Eric Risberg/AP, FILE

The update was needed because of a "GPS time rollover issue," according to Apple. The devices, however, won't be impacted until just before midnight UTC on Nov. 3. If the deadline is missed, users will have to back up and restore their phones using a computer, Apple said.

The handful of users who still have the iPhone 4s or the iPad 4th generation will also be required to update their devices, according to Apple, though failure to do so will only mean that GPS functions on that device won't work.
description: Apple warns that those still using an iPhone 5 must update their iOS or lose access to many apps and the app store.
